intro: Sessea farinosa, commonly known as the silky sessea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive, silky-hairy foliage. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with trifoliate leaves and small, pea-like flowers. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are often dispersed by wind. Sessea farinosa is adapted to arid environments and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats.
